intro: Anemopaegma scandens, commonly known as the climbing anemopaegma, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, twining stems that enable it to climb and spread along other vegetation. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that are clustered in umbels, typical of the carrot family. Its leaves are pinnately divided, with finely toothed margins, contributing to its ornamental appeal. Anemopaegma scandens is often found in moist, shaded areas of woodland and along stream banks.
